messages.message:
Curious what leads to source tracking cases where we extract information from the wrong field. Note in this screenshot, we are pulling from the earned column for the first 3 but correctly pulling from the paid column in the last row. However, only the last row has the difference between earned and paid. The values in the end are all correct. Is there logic that pushed the last row to be taken from the paid column?

cc: @Sunny Khatri
cc @Vishnu as well in case thereâ€™s something special about provenance for list-of-object fields
We simply look for list of output tokens and find those where they appear in the doc. So `1.21` was part of theat token list.
How do we deal with output tokens appearing in multiple cases in the doc for example here the `1.21` is the correct location (presumably because it only appears once)
We try to disambiguate via LLM. Earlier we had issues where wrong exact value was being highlighted, we updated our prompts to help narrow down which is the correct line related to the query.
